isis.stitle: CAB: 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 AND 8600 MODELS - REMOVE - CAB DOOR WINDOW REGULATOR ARM ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: CAB DOOR WINDOW REGULATOR ARM ASSEMBLY

svcsubproc.title: Remove Front Cab Door Window Regulator Arm Assembly on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models

step1.para:
Remove front cab door trim panel, refer to
CAB DOOR TRIM PANEL
. If front cab door is equipped with electric door window and locks, refer to Remove Front Cab Door Trim Panel with Electric Door Window and Locks on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models. If front cab door is equipped with manual door window and locks, refer to Remove Front Cab Door Trim Panel with Manual Door Window and Locks on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

Remove front cab door inner door panel water shield, refer to
CAB DOOR INNER DOOR PANEL WATER SHIELD
. For removing front cab door inner door panel water shield, refer to Remove Front Cab Door Inner Door Panel Water Shield on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

Remove front cab door window electric motor, refer to
CAB DOOR WINDOW ELECTRIC MOTOR
. For removing front cab door window electric motor, refer to Remove Front Cab Door Window Electric Motor on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 61 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If vehicle is equipped with manual door window, temporarily place the window regulator handle (Item 6) on the window regulator handle shaft (Item 7) and lower cab door glass (Item 4) to the bottom of front cab door (Item 3).

Working through the cab door access opening (Item 8), using a blunt tip flat blade screw driver (Item 9), carefully pry window regulator arm (Item 10) from the cab door window slide block (Item 11) in the cab door window slide rail (Item 12), driver side shown.
Slide cab door glass (Item 4) to the top of front cab door (Item 3) and support it there.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 82 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove torx head bolt (Item 1) from inner cab door handle (Item 2), driver side shown.
Slide inner cab door handle (Item 2) to the right enough to pull both retaining tabs (Item 3) out of the modular door hardware assembly (Item 4), driver side shown.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 83 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Rotate inner cab door handle (Item 1) so the bottom of it rest above the window regulator assembly coil spring (Item 2), driver side shown.

warning.para: Be sure to use an appropriate tool and use care when removing the window regulator assembly coil spring from behind the retaining tab on the modular door hardware assembly per step 10 below, to prevent bodily injury since the window regulator assembly coil spring will be in the loaded position during removal.

step1.para: Using an appropriate tool, release window regulator assembly coil spring (Item 2) from the retaining tab (Item 3) on the modular door hardware assembly (Item 4) and release the tension on the window regulator assembly coil spring, driver side shown.
Remove window regulator assembly coil spring (Item 2) from the window regulator arm assembly shaft (Item 5), driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 83. Cab Door Window Regulator Arm Assembly and Coil Spring

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 84 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Once the window regulator assembly coil spring (Item 2, Figure 83) is removed. Use a flat blade screw driver (Item 1) in the slot of the window regulator arm assembly shaft (Item 2), rotate it counter clockwise and remove the window regulator arm assembly shaft from the window regulator arm (Item 3). Remove window regulator arm from behind the modular door hardware assembly (Item 4), driver side shown. Lay window regulator assembly coil spring, window regulator arm assembly shaft and window regulator arm out of the way and save for installation, unless damaged and being replaced.

figure.caption: Figure 84. Window Regulator Arm and Window Regulator Arm Assembly Shaft

step1.para: Repeat procedure to remove passenger side front cab door window regulator arm and window regulator arm assembly shaft.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Rear Cab Door Window Regulator Arm Assembly on Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models

step1.para:
Remove rear cab door trim panel, refer to
CAB DOOR TRIM PANEL
. If rear cab door is equipped with electric door window and locks, refer to Remove Rear Cab Door Trim Panel with Electric Door Window and Locks on Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models. If rear cab door is equipped with manual door window and locks, refer to Remove Rear Cab Door Trim Panel with Manual Door Window and Locks on Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

Remove rear cab door inner door panel water shield, refer to
CAB DOOR INNER DOOR PANEL WATER SHIELD
. For removing rear cab door inner door panel water shield, refer to Remove Rear Cab Door Inner Door Panel Water Shield on Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

Remove rear cab door window electric motor, refer to
CAB DOOR WINDOW ELECTRIC MOTOR
. For removing rear cab door window electric motor, refer to Remove Rear Cab Door Window Electric Motor on Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 62 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If vehicle is equipped with manual door window, temporarily place the window regulator handle (Item 6) on the window regulator handle shaft (Item 7) and lower cab door glass (Item 4) to the bottom of rear cab door (Item 3).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 82 for Items in parentheses.

Slide inner cab door handle (Item 2) to the right enough to pull both retaining tabs (Item 3) out of the modular door hardware assembly (Item 4), driver side shown.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 83 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Rotate inner cab door handle (Item 1) so the bottom of it rest above the window regulator assembly coil spring (Item 2), driver side shown.

warning.para: Be sure to use an appropriate tool and use care when removing the window regulator assembly coil spring from behind the retaining tab on the modular door hardware assembly per step 10 below, to prevent bodily injury since the window regulator assembly coil spring will be in the loaded position during removal.

step1.para: Using an appropriate tool, release window regulator assembly coil spring (Item 2) from the retaining tab (Item 3) on the modular door hardware assembly (Item 4) and release the tension on the window regulator assembly coil spring, driver side shown.
Remove window regulator assembly coil spring (Item 2) from the window regulator arm assembly shaft (Item 5), driver side shown.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 84 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Once the window regulator assembly coil spring (Item 2, Figure 83) is removed. Use a flat blade screw driver (Item 1) in the slot of the window regulator arm assembly shaft (Item 2), rotate it counter clockwise and remove the window regulator arm assembly shaft from the window regulator arm (Item 3). Remove window regulator arm from behind the modular door hardware assembly (Item 4), driver side shown. Lay window regulator assembly coil spring, window regulator arm assembly shaft and window regulator arm out of the way and save for installation, unless damaged and being replaced.
